text: hi guys I'm Lindsey strand and today on
sweet talk I'm making oatmeal raisin
bars these packable snackable treats are
perfect for a picnic or a bake sale and
as you'll see they're super easy to make
so I'm making these brownies style which
means I'm starting with my butter and
sugar this is 3/4 cup of melted butter
which is one and a half sticks unsalted
butter of course today I'm adding 3/4
cup of light brown sugar 1/4 cup of
granulated sugar we use more brown sugar
here because it gives a really nice
molasses e flavor it makes them a little
more chewy if we did more granulated
sugar they'd be more crispy and then one
egg room temperature 1/2 teaspoon of
ground cinnamon that gives that really
great oatmeal raisin flavor and then 1/2
teaspoon of kosher salts so give this a
whisk make sure all the sugar gets
incorporated mmm smell that cinnamon
nice and toasty and if you give these a
good whisk like this they should get a
nice crackling top all right that looks
good so this I'm adding 1 cup of
all-purpose flour lid off 2 cups of
rolled oats really important that these
are the old-fashioned kind and not quit
cooking because you want to get that
great - and texture from the oats and
quick cooking oats will just kind of
dissolve into the batter and not give it
any texture and then we have 1 cup of
raisins
now the Test Kitchen is kind of divided
in half and half between raisin lover's
and raisin haters I personally I'm a fan
of raisins but I know a lot of people
don't like them so if you don't you
could always sub in chocolate chips you
could do dried cherries you could do
some other kind of delicious dried fruit
or just leave them out and make them
like oatmeal Blondie's I'll just fold
this together I love that you don't need
any special equipment for this no mix
are necessary you
need a bowl and a spatula and a whisk I
guess it's looking moistened so I have
an 8 inch baking pan I've buttered it
lined it with parchment paper so it's
really easy to remove so I'll just add
the batter to the pan like that I'll
kind of press it in with a little mini
offset always dampen your fingers and
use those as well so you don't get
sticky fingers smoothing this out is
it's such a thick batter you really have
to make sure it's a nice even layer here
just like that it is so easy now these
are going into the oven it's set at 350
degrees I'm gonna bake them for 25 to 30
minutes until a toothpick inserted into
the center comes out clean so I took
these out of the oven I let them cool
completely my kitchen smells amazing
right now and I'm just gonna run a knife
around the edges of the pan to make sure
we don't have too much stick egde here
sounds like there might be a little bit
and hear how crispy those edges are
that's good now this is why we have
those little flaps this is perfect gonna
come out clean just like that and you
can see all of the crackly edges that is
from mixing in the melted butter and
giving it kind of a vigorous stir that
gives it that nice crackly effect on top
oh I'm just gonna cut these into squares
Wow I can tell he's gonna be really

I'm gonna cut them into 16 YUM they

brown sugar chewy bar mmm they're so
